w:r.w:t: The purpose of this document is to provide the key parameters required to define the Operating Window Limits for
Large Machines, back pressure turbines, condensing turbines, centrifugal compressors,

Purpose of this alarm is to detect early in advance any deviation from ‘’normal values’’ before reaching the alarm from the monitoring system. The given value shall be adapted to each machine, according historical data.

, and not the temperature of the oil return from the bearing
It’s rather important to be sure that the bearing temperature is measured on the most loaded
otherwise the alarms shall be adapted.

For a 535°C inlet steam temperature turbine, typical values are: below a drop of 25°C/min, no risk, and for higher drop the time needed is increased, 30 minutes for a drop of 45°C.

the trip valve, and before the trip valve.
Inlet temperature measurement shall be located as close as possible before the trip valve. Purpose of the lower limit is to avoid risk of liquid droplet formation in the low pressure stage of the
this is especially true for condensing turbines.
Extraction pressure shall be measured between turbine flange and extraction check valve. Extraction check valve shall control the extraction pressure avoiding reaching relief valves setting.
Extraction pressure shall be measured between turbine flange and extraction check valve. The extraction temperature is controlled by the control valves of the low pressure section of the turbine.

where N is max continuous speed.

Purpose of this alarm is to detect early in advance any deviation from ‘’normal values’’ before reaching the alarm from the monitoring system. The given value shall be adapted to each machine, according historical data.
Bearing temperature shall be the metal temperature of the pad, and not the temperature of the oil return line from the bearing
. It’s rather important to be sure that the bearing temperature is measured on the most loaded
otherwise the alarms shall be adapted.
Except for startup phases turbine shall be operated in the region between minimum governor and maximum governor speed (taking into account the limits of the driven equipment).
is not mentioned in this table because the
is outside of the operating speed range

The sudden inlet temperature variation may result in a differential thermal expansion of the rotor and the casing, and potential contacts between static and rotating parts. For a 535°C inlet steam temperature turbine, typical values are: below a drop of 25°C/min, no risk, and for higher drop the time needed is increased, 30 minutes for a drop of 45°C.
During start-up phase, avoid differential thermal expansion of the lower and upper casings due to the non-uniform steam distribution.
To be set if risk of condensation
To be set if risk of condensation

To be set to avoid risk of surge
Purpose is to avoid liquid ingress into the compressor for each suction drum located before any compressor stage. Level shall be in accordance with drum design

of the flange of each compression stage.
design temperature shall take into account the mechanical integrity of the compressor and the risk of polymerization of gas content.

where N is max continuous speed.

Purpose of this alarm is to detect early in advance any deviation from ‘’normal values’’ before reaching the alarm from the monitoring system. The given value shall be adapted to each machine, according historical data
Bearing temperature shall be the metal temperature of the pad, and not the temperature of the oil return line from the bearing
. It’s rather important to be sure that the bearing temperature is measured on the most loaded
otherwise the alarms shall be adapted.
Inlet and exhaust gland steam pressure may be different, in that case min and max value shall be in accordance.
During start-up phase, avoid differential thermal expansion of the lower and upper casings due to the non-uniform steam distribution.
Oil tank level shall be checked on a routine basis to ensure that the oil level is not dropping, and to be able to analyze and refill before reaching any LSL or PSL
